_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation is an ethanol plant located in York, Nebraska currently producing approximately 50-60 MM gallons of denatured ethanol per year. Recently, Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation has undergone a management change. Once operated under High Plains Corporation, the facility now operates under Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation.

Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:

Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation has a commitment to worker and public safety.  Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, plant personnel will respond to contain the release as necessary according to Emergency Response Plans.

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:

Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation ethanol plant is located in York, York County, Nebraska.

The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol from corn.  The regulated substances under the RMP program are Anhydrous Ammonia and Denaturant.  Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release would be about 5.1 miles due to the amount of ammonia stored on site.  Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release would be about 0.5 miles due to the amount of denaturant stored on site. 

Off-site Consequence Analysis Results:

The worst case scenario at the facility is the release of all 154,000 pounds of ammonia creating a toxic cloud.  The worst-case scenario is based on the release of all ammonia stored on site.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 5.1 miles from the center of the plant.  Rural residence homes are located within this 5.1 mile radius.

Although Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation has numerous controls in place to prevent such a release and to manage potential consequences, no credit for administrative con

trols or passive mitigation measures were taken into account in evaluating this scenario.

Since the facility qualifies as a Program 3 due to the close proximity of public receptors, Program Safety Management has to be completed for this facility.

Five Year Accident History:

Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation has not had any spills on site in the five years.  The facility is subject to RMP upon delivery of substances onsite.

Emergency Response Program Information:

The Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation ethanol plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency response, including a Health and Safety Plan.  An SPCC has also been revised and implemented in accordance with applicable regulatory standards and timeframes.

The facility also conducts employee training as part of facility activities.  Abengoa Bioenergy Corporation's corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public and environmental safety, which is reflected in facility plans and training activities.

A safety inspection and a review of the facility's emergency response plan has been completed in conjunction with this RMP revision.
